summary: A simple mod that increases the chances of decapitating your foes when you would normally have the opportunity.
descriptionHtml:
A simple mod that increases the chances of decapitating your foes when you would normally have the opportunity.

Still requires that you meet the normal conditions for decapitation, meaning that you must have the right perk, use the right weapon, and attack with a standing power attack against a non-busy NPC-type opponent. 

Note: Decap also only occurs along with the slow-mo finishing move animation.

You will also decapitate with any hand-to-hand power attack finishing move against an eligible opponent.

Necessary conditions to activate kill move:
- Facing your opponent
- Target not equipping
- Self not in bashing attack state
- Target not blocking
- Target not sitting
- Attack must kill
- Target not leaning
- Target not laying
- Target not staggered (removed)
- Within range on Z-axis (widened fully)
- Target was last hostile actore (removed)
- Target not paralyzed (removed)
- Target is type \'NPC\', not flagged as non-decapitatable, not a ghost

V2.3 - 2012 Feb 12:
Added global variable for hand-to-hand decaps KillMoveH2HDecap, 1=On, 0=Off, 2 versions on SkyrimNexus http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9107

V2.2 - 2012 Feb 11:
General clean-up, seems to be working better with power attacks all-around

V2.1 
Removed Last Hostile requirement
Removed non-paralyzed requirement (needs testing)
Hopefully fixed reverse unarmed decaps

V2 - 2012 Feb 10: 
Added the ability to perform unarmed decaps. 
Should not have to be the last hostile actor to trigger kill moves.

V1 - 2012 Feb 9:
Increased global chance of decapitation under normal decapitation chance conditions.

Known bugs:
- unarmed non-power attacks don\'t seem to work yet

Known incompatibilities:
- Carry 100x your weight mod (reported, needs testing)
- Probably anything that directly affects animation hierarchies for kill moves




Future versions:
- Variable percentage chance
- Allow decap in more combat situations
- Increase chances of slow-mo finishing moves
